# alternateTitle

**Instance Property**

The string displayed by the button when it’s in its alternate state.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var alternateTitle: String { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is the string that appears on the button when it’s in its alternate state, or the empty string if the button doesn’t display an alternate title. Note that some button types don’t display an alternate title. By default, a button’s alternate title is “Button.”

## Related Documentation

- **font**: The font that the cell uses to display text.
- **setButtonType(_:)**: Sets how the button highlights while pressed and how it shows its state.

## Setting Titles

- **attributedAlternateTitle**: The title displayed by the button when it’s in its alternate state, as an attributed string.
- **attributedTitle**: The title displayed by the button when it’s in its normal state as an attributed string.
- **title**: The title displayed on the button when it’s in its normal state.
